name: Sencha
description: In late 2009, I became creative director at Sencha (Ext JS at the time) and began to help the recently funded company shape it's global look and feel. This included coming up with the new name, logo, and redesigning a mountain of corporate material from print collateral to website to framework themes.

name: jQTouch
description: I created jQTouch a few years ago in an effort to create iPhone apps though mobile Safari. Since then, it has grown to become the most popular mobile JavaScript framework in use, and now also includes Android support. I just released a new beta (beta 4) which includes Zepto support and brings the framework under 30kb total.

name: Dyad Communications
description: I worked for 3 years at Dyad Communications, where I eventually became an associate partner, and directed the company’s digital works.

name: Compass Recipes
description: After working on Sencha Touch and various other Sencha projects like Animator and Ext JS, I started a default styling library for apps and UI. After looking around, I found a similar project called Compass Recipes and began contributing my stuff there.

name: WebKitBits
description: WebKitBits is a tumblog I maintain about WebKit: the browser engine built into Safari, Google Chrome, iOS, Android, and BlackBerry.
